result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elfego Torres Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:04 AM Defendant Elfego Torres Hernandez in court.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn spanish interpreter Christina Green appears by zoom video. Court finds the defendant indigent. Court appoints attorney Joshua Grube, defendant to pay $150/ month for attorney fees.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Indigency hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:14 AM Defendant Elfego Torres Hernandez appeared in direct phone contact with Sworn Spanish interpreter Victor Gonzalez appeared by video as interpreter for defendant. Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued for defendant to file paperwork for court appointed attorney. Remand to branch 2 for scheduling of court appointed attorney. Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:40 PM Defendant Elfego Torres Hernandez appeared by video, in custody.  Spanish interpreter Victor Gonzalez appeared by video for defendant.   Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Elfego Torres Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to attorney, address updated, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $1300 set.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with El Ra Bowl.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
